name: Mozambique
currentCrisisSummary:
Mozambique confronts a violent **Islamist insurgency** (ASWJ/ISIS) in Cabo Delgado province, driven by the **'resource curse'** and **state neglect rooted in colonial underdevelopment**. The conflict is fuelled by grievances over **illicit economies (heroin, rubies)** and exclusion from the massive **natural gas reserves**, which attracted billions in **foreign investment** but brought no benefit locally.

This fuels rebellion the **corrupt, centralised state** cannot contain. The conflict is internationalised, involving regional troops and **private mercenaries** protecting **gas projects**. It exemplifies a crisis born from a **predatory economic model**: state collaboration with **multinational corporations** to **extract wealth**, treating citizens as obstacles and **structurally producing** violent uprising and suffering.

colonialRoot.legacy:
**Portugal's colonial rule** was brutal and underdeveloped. The economy used **forced labour** (***chibalo***), land was expropriated for settlers, with no investment in locals. The **colonial state** was purely for **extraction**.

At independence, Mozambique was impoverished, scarred, lacking skilled administrators. The **war of liberation** entrenched a militarised culture. **Economic sabotage** during the settlers' **scorched-earth withdrawal** (1974-75) crippled the new state, causing near-total **economic collapse**.

historicalContext.title: Post-Independence Destabilisation
historicalContext.description: After FRELIMO established a socialist state (1975), it was targeted by white-minority regimes (Rhodesia, **apartheid South Africa**). They created the **RENAMO insurgency**, plunging Mozambique into a 16-year **civil war**. This was **externally-driven destabilisation** to destroy an anti-racist project, shattering infrastructure.

historicalContext.title: Neoliberal Debt and Structural Adjustment
historicalContext.description: Devastated by war, Mozambique turned to the **IMF**/**World Bank** (late 1980s). Subsequent **Structural Adjustment Programmes (SAPs)** mandated **privatisation** and severe **austerity**. While enriching elites and opening to **foreign capital**, these **neoliberal reforms** entrenched inequality and poverty fuelling instability.

historicalContext.title: The Cabo Delgado Insurgency (ASWJ/ISIS)
historicalContext.description: The 2017 insurgency (**Ahlu Sunnah wa Jama'a**, now linked to **ISIS**) channelled legitimate local grievances (poverty, neglect) into a violent **jihadist** ideology. This conflict is not just about **gas**; it is layered upon decades of elite state complicity in **illicit economies**, notably **heroin and ruby trafficking**, which created a predatory environment that the insurgency exploits.

historicalContext.title: The Resource Curse and Elite Corruption
historicalContext.description: Discovery of **gas reserves** and illicit trade supercharged **corruption**. The '**$2 Billion Hidden Debts**' scandal exemplifies this: elites and **international banks** colluded in **loan fraud**. This **grand corruption** crippled the budget, deepened **dependency**, confirming the state exists to enrich elites and **foreign partners**.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: **Accountability** is elusive. Despite legal proceedings over **'hidden debts'**, key figures escaped consequences. In Cabo Delgado, abuses by insurgents, state forces, and **foreign private military contractors** are reported. Lack of effective investigation creates **impunity**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 784,000 internally displaced by violence from the **Islamist insurgency** and state counter-insurgency.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Thousands forced into asylum in Tanzania by conflict, though most displacement is internal.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Thousands killed since 2017, victims of conflict driven by **illicit trades**, **resource wealth**, and historical neglect.

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Est. 1.5 million require aid due to societal breakdown caused by the **resource-fuelled war**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 900,000 face acute hunger as **conflict disrupts agriculture** in marginalised regions.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 100 health facilities destroyed, leaving populations vulnerable due to attacks and **state failure**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Education Disrupted
humanitarianImpact.description: Hundreds of thousands of children denied education by insecurity linked to the **gas conflict**.

timeline.event: **Formal Colonisation**: In the 'Scramble for Africa', Portugal leases vast territories to private charter companies to enforce its colonial claim. These companies impose brutal rule, seizing land and instituting the 'chibalo' system of forced labour to plunder resources.

**Formation of FRELIMO**: Uniting several nationalist groups, the Mozambique Liberation Front (FRELIMO) is founded in exile under the leadership of Eduardo Mondlane, with the explicit goal of launching an armed struggle against Portuguese rule.
**War of Independence**: The FRELIMO liberation front wages a decade-long armed struggle against Portuguese colonial rule.

**Scorched-Earth Exodus**: Following a coup in Portugal, departing settlers engage in widespread economic sabotage, destroying infrastructure and assets to deliberately cripple the economy of the soon-to-be independent nation.
**Independence**: Mozambique becomes independent, with FRELIMO forming a single-party socialist state.
**Civil War of Destabilisation**: The apartheid-backed RENAMO insurgency wages a brutal proxy war against the FRELIMO government, leading to the deaths of around one million people.
**Neoliberal Turn**: Under immense pressure, FRELIMO abandons Marxism-Leninism and accepts a new constitution and IMF-led structural adjustment, opening the economy to foreign capital.
**Gas Discovery**: Enormous offshore natural gas reserves are discovered in the Rovuma Basin off the coast of Cabo Delgado, sparking a rush for concessions by multinational energy firms.
**'Hidden Debts' Scandal**: A $2 billion loan and corruption scandal involving state elites and international banks is exposed, triggering a financial crisis.

**Cabo Delgado Insurgency**: A violent **Islamist insurgency** (ASWJ/ISIS) rooted in local grievances over **illicit trades (rubies, heroin)** and state neglect begins in Cabo Delgado, attacking state and civilian targets and displacing hundreds of thousands.

donate.description: A leading Mozambican civil society organisation that promotes transparency, good governance, and fights corruption, particularly in the extractive industries.

advocacy.title: Cancel Odious Debt
advocacy.description: Demand the full cancellation of Mozambique's odious debts, including those from the 'hidden debts' scandal, to free up public funds for essential services.

advocacy.title: Demand Resource Transparency
advocacy.description: Advocate for transparency and accountability in the natural resource sector, ensuring that **gas, ruby, and timber** revenues benefit the entire population, especially local communities.

advocacy.title: End Impunity in Cabo Delgado
advocacy.description: Support calls for an end to impunity for human rights abuses committed by all parties to the conflict in Cabo Delgado.

advocacy.title: Support Community-Led Development
advocacy.description: Promote community-led development models that give local populations meaningful control over their land and resources.

advocacy.title: Prosecute Corrupt International Banks
advocacy.description: Call for the prosecution of the international banks and financial actors who facilitated the corrupt 'hidden debts' scandal.

reading.title: *A Complicated War: The Harrowing of Mozambique*
reading.description: William Finnegan's profound account of the devastating civil war fueled by apartheid South Africa and its impact on civilians.

reading.title: *The Wretched of the Earth*
reading.description: Frantz Fanon's foundational text on colonialism, violence, and liberation, essential for understanding Mozambique's anti-colonial struggle.
